thread.title: Ground News - Riding against the odds: Najiah Knight's quest to make bull riding history
thread.title_full: Ground News - Riding against the odds: Najiah Knight's quest to make bull riding history

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Riding against the odds: Najiah Knight's quest to make bull riding history
text:
Summary by Ground News Najiah Knight, 17, is the only woman to qualify in the 16-18 age division for this month's Junior World Finals in Las Vegas. The sport is dangerous, with riders frequently injured and even killed. Najiah: "I wanted it to go perfectly, but it didn't always go that way" Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
The Christian Science Monitor Center High Factuality Other: The First Church of Christ, Scientist Riding against the odds: Najiah Knight's quest to make bull riding history Najiah Knight aspires to be the first woman in the Professional Bull Riders tour's top level. Najiah's fearless pursuit of her dream is supported by her family, who believe in her potential to make history in the male-dominated sport.
